lexUnit.name: splash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or be scattered in drops.

sentence.text: I wait until it fills itself and then I swat it , the blood splashing over my hand .
Blood poured from his nose , splashing in large crimson blots on the sheaf of white paper in front of him .
Blood drummed in her ears , blood gurgled like vomit in her throat , blood splashed in bright globules against the retinas of her closed eyes .
The ladle hit the stew with such force that the liquid splashed onto the white tablecloth , and , almost stuttering now , Alice cried , ` What a thing to say !
The pump leaked and a jet of yellow liquid Splashed onto the path with every stroke .
Glass and white liquid splashed outwards .
It 's early evening in Leicester Square and the rain is splashing down .
The first great drops of rain splashed on the ground beside them as they ran .
Here at 5,000 feet the tepid breeze coiled round the trees in oily currents and several drops of warm rain splashed widely on uncovered skin .
Warm rain splashed on to the immaculate plastic-covered seats .
The acid rain was splashing around my feet , rapidly dissolving my boots .

Alexandra suddenly found she was crying , great gulping sobs , tears splashing down on to the kitchen counter , an aching sense of something very precious which she had discarded without even a second glance .
Large tears splashed into her teacup .
And the water is splashing over my dress , Alida noted , to herself .
Sometimes it shrivelled into itself like water splashing on hot stones , then flared out again as its owner shrank down in a spasm of coughing and straightened up again .
Water poured through the guttering and splashed noisily from the eaves .
The Antarctic ozone ` hole " in the stratosphere that splashed across the headlines in 1988 , has continued to grow and is now the size of the USA .
The first heavy drops splashed in coin shapes on the pavement below and in their tubs the pink flowers on the forecourt dipped and swayed .
Suddenly a Hurricane came down in a screaming dive and splashed into the sea .
By then large drops were falling all around me , another landing on my wig and one splashing on my shoulder , making me jump as if I 'd been prodded with a therm-knife .
She turned down the heat quicKly but some of the fat had splashed on to the flames and the blue smoke increased in density .
A large tear splashed from the frog-magician 's eye .
` Dietmar dropped a bottle of wine on the floor and it splashed everywhere .
